page.title: 20SUTTONS SCHOOL FETE
page.content:
June sees the school fete come round and the weather was fine for it. When 2pm came only a few people were there but soon the school was crowded.
In the hall were stalls selling plants, cakes, drinks and raffle tickets. In other parts of the school books, toys, gifts and other things were for sale;.
Outside was SPIN THE ARROW, GOLF, DARTS and THROW THE WELLIE. Many people queued up to throw wet sponges at YE OLD FOOL. This was very popular because the Deputy Headteacher was one of the two men who stood in the stocks to be bombarded wih wet sponges.
The day was enjoyed by all who came - even the fools.
